# Mark bad weather, either by a range of exposure numbers or UT time
# type is one of
# * bad: repeat this observation; existing data are probably useless
# * marginal: not photometric, but usable
start, end, type

# run 1a

2016-03-13T15:00:00, 2016-03-14T03:45:00, marginal
2016-03-14T05:35:00, 2016-03-14T06:00:00, marginal
2016-03-14T06:00:00, 2016-03-14T07:45:00, bad
2016-03-14T07:45:00, 2016-03-14T08:00:00, marginal

2016-03-14T15:00:00, 2016-03-14T23:53:00, marginal
2016-03-15T01:00:00, 2016-03-15T01:50:00, marginal
2016-03-15T02:20:00, 2016-03-15T03:10:00, marginal
2016-03-15T03:54:00, 2016-03-15T04:21:00, marginal

2016-03-16T02:50:00, 2016-03-16T04:00:00, marginal
2016-03-16T04:00:00, 2016-03-16T15:00:00, bad

2016-03-16T15:00:00, 2016-03-17T02:05:05, bad
2016-03-17T02:05:00, 2016-03-17T05:15:00, marginal
2016-03-17T05:15:00, 2016-03-17T07:42:00, bad
2016-03-17T07:42:00, 2016-03-17T15:00:00, marginal
